item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S2113; text as passed Senate: CR S2113; text of measure as introduced: CR S2092)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S2113; text as passed Senate: CR S2113; text of measure as introduced: CR S2092)

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Senate that, until the segregated account funds of its customers have been fully repaid and federal investigations have revealed both the cause of, and parties responsible for, the loss of millions of dollars of its customers' money, bonuses should not be paid to the executives and employees responsible for the day-to-day management and operations of MF Global.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Expresses the sense of the Senate that, until the segregated account funds of its customers have been fully repaid in full, and federal investigations have revealed both the cause of, and parties responsible for, the loss of millions of dollars of its customer money, bonuses should not be paid to the executives and employees responsible for the day-to-day management and operations of MF Global.

bill.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate that executives of the bankrupt firm MF Global should not be rewarded with bonuses while customer money is still missing.

item.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate that executives of the bankrupt firm MF Global should not be rewarded with bonuses while customer money is still missing.
A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate that executives of the bankrupt firm MF Global should not be rewarded with bonuses while customer money is still missing.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
